Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in finding voluntary reavailment of home country's protection
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s. 108(1)(a)
Credibility_Assessment: Nsende claimed no intent to reavail protection; Board did not adequately address his explanations
Basis_of_Claim: Voluntary reavailment of protection of country of nationality
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Intent and voluntariness in re-availing protection
Application_Error: Failure to properly consider or justify rejection of applicant's explanations
Review_Outcome: Application allowed, case remitted for reconsideration
Evidence_Ignored: Applicantâ€™s stated reasons for obtaining passport
Application_Factor: Use of national passport for business purposes
Decision_Outcome: Initial cessation of refugee status overturned on review
Decision_Review_Issue: Adequacy of reasoning regarding voluntariness and intent
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived re-engagement with country of nationality through passport acquisition
Credibility_Issues: Applicant's credibility partially challenged but not fully assessed
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimed non-voluntary use of passport, no intent to reavail protection
